dialogues.speaker: BONG
dialogues.text: His gesticulation and a shuffle step upset his balance -- trips -- falls -- catches the ledge --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- No, please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is hanging onto the icy ledge by his fingertips. His f dangle away. Snow falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking STEEPLY UP.

dialogues.speaker: CLOCK
dialogues.text: Its second hand is making its descent.

dialogues.speaker: NORVILLE
dialogues.text: Falling.

dialogues.speaker: MUSSBURGER
dialogues.text: Laughing.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND HAND
dialogues.text: Descending.

dialogues.speaker: NORVILLE
dialogues.text: Falling, turning lazily in the air -- and suddenly, with great moaning sound -- he stops, suspended in mid-air, he down, feet in the air. It is much like the freeze frame on Waring Hudsucker that the title of the film was supered over. He waves his arms, to no effect, looks around.

dialogues.speaker: PEOPLE IN STREET
dialogues.text: Frozen in attitudes of laughter, celebration. Snow sifts  silently down around their motionless bodies.

dialogues.speaker: MUSSBURGER
dialogues.text: In his office, frozen with an idiotic laugh pasted to his face.

dialogues.speaker: HIS PERPETUAL MOTION BALLS
dialogues.text: Frozen, one ball swung out but suspended, hanging at the  apex of its arc. Outside the great arched window, snow fa

dialogues.speaker: NORVILLE
dialogues.text: He alone can move, but doesn't fall. He looks awkwardly a his body in a dive-bomber attitude, canted steeply down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its sweep second hand is arrested on its downward sweep. WHINING NOISES emanate from within.

dialogues.speaker: GREAT GEAR
dialogues.text: The broom handle has been jammed between two cogs, stoppi them. We PULL BACK ALONG the handle to reveal Moses, who thrust it there, and who now TURNS back over his shoulder address the CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strictly speakin', I'm never spozed  to do this but... have you got a  better idea?

dialogues.speaker: NORVILLE
dialogues.text: Twisting back to look up over his shoulder; there is a DI very distant -- SINGING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking up the length of the Hudsucker Building. Someone something wrapped in white is flying toward us, coming do from the stars. We can make out a male voice, accompanied by STRUMMING:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll be comin' around the mountain  when she comes, She'll be comin'  around the mountain when she comes...

dialogues.speaker: NORVILLE
dialogues.text: He gapes.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: -- For it is an Angel, arrives. He is a balding man, wear rimless glasses, in a white robe, large feathery wings  sprouting from his back and beating heavily until he come to rest, in midair. He puts aside the harp he has been  strumming on a nearby windowsill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love that tune. How ya doin', kid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr... Mr. Hudsucker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ta-daaaa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Presenting himself, he spreads his arms and stamps his fo foot, forgetting that there is nothing beneath his foot t stamp. He lurches forward, momentarily losing his balance

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Wooooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rights himself. The halo spinning lazily over his head has been jarred askew. With a flick of his forefinger he  rights it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...How d'ya like this thing? They're  all wearin' em upstairs now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He blows a dismissive raspberry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...It's a fad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pats at his robe, produces a white cigar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Anyway. I hear you've been having,  uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He casually flicks his thumb out of his fist, lighting it He lights the cigar off his thumb, takes a puff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Been having some problems with  the board. The more things change,  know what Iyayayeeeeee...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pain reminds him that he has forgotten to extinguish his  flaming thumb, which he now waves frantically about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Jesus Christopher -- That smarts...  Where was I? Oh yeah, the board. I  guess Sidney's been puttin' the screws  to ya, huh, Norman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norville.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm. Well, say what you like about the man's ethics, he's a balls-to- the-wall businessman. Beat ya any  way he can. Straight for the jugular.  Very effective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway. Any particular reason you  didn't give him my Blue Letter? I  mean, Jesus, Norman, just a dying  man's last words and wishes, no big  deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? Oh, geez, Mr. Hudsucker, I  apologize, there was an awful lot of  excitement and I guess I must've  mislaid --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's sittin' in your apron pocket,  right where you left it. Imbecile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norville reaches in and -- pulls out the wrinkled Blue Le

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, geez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Failure to deliver a Blue Letter is  grounds for dismissal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geez, I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, it's New Year's, I'm not gonna  add to your woes. I'm just saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yessir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, why don't ya read it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, go ahead. Might learn somethin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tears open the envelope, reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'From the desk of Waring Hudsucker.  To. Sidney J. Mussburger. Regarding.  My demise. Dear Sid. By the time you  read this, I will have joined the  organization upstairs -- an exciting  new beginning. I will retain fond  memories of the many years you and I -- '

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, it's the standard  resignation boilerplate -- go down  to the second paragraph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Many years, uh... I know that you  will be wondering why I have decided  to move on, ending my tenure at  Hudsucker, and here on Earth. You  will be thinking, Why now, when things  are going so well? Granted, from the  standpoint of our balance sheet and  financials, sure, sure, we're doing  fine. However, Sid. These things  have long since ceased to give me  pleasure. I look at myself now and  no longer see the idealistic young  man who started this company. Now I  see only an empty shell whom others  call a 'success.' How has this come  to pass? When and why did I trade  all of my hopes, dreams and  aspirations, for the emptiness of  power and wealth? What the heck have  I done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Norville reads Hudsucker casually examines his fingern then pats down a yawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: '...Looking back now, Sid, I see  that I allowed time and age to corrupt  my dreams. Instead of fiercely  guarding what was timeless inside of  myself, I let the hubbub of earthly  commerce erode my character, and  dissolve my better self. How is it  that some manage to preserve  themselves where I have failed?  Sidney, I do not know. Perhaps if  others love you, you may more securely  love yourself -- but I am alone. I  loved a woman once, Sid, as you well  know -- a beautiful, vibrant lady,  an angel who in her wisdom saw fit  to choose you instead of I...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norville is interrupted by loud blubbering. He looks up. Hudsucker is weeping loudly into a white handkerchief. He saws at his nose, gives it a loud honk, and urgently  quavers in a voice strangled with emotion:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skip this part...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He waves his hankie in get-on-with-it circles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Last paragraph, last paragraph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norville looks down the page.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: '...And so, Sid, the future does not  belong to such as I -- nor even you.  We have made our compromises with  time. The future belongs to the young,  who may more energetically wage the  battle against corruption.  Accordingly, in the spirit of hope,  and the ringing in of the new, I  hereby bequeath my entire interest  in the company, and my seat on the  board, to whomever is Hudsucker's  most recent employee at the time of  my demise. I know this will disappoint  you -- you, Sid, who have served so  diligently and for so long. But --'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- tough titty toenails!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He roars with laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...That'll show the bastard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He merrily wipes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Yeah, go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: '...But Sid, let me urge you to work  closely with the new president, and  to keep giving Hudsucker Industries  all your energies -- but not your  soul. For while we must strive for  success, we must not worship it.  Long live the Hud. Waring  Hudsucker...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norville gives a musingly appreciative nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Geez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pleased with himself:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup. It's all there. Well, see that  it gets delivered in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hudsucker picks up his lyre and heads back up toward the  stars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheeel beeee...

dialogues.speaker: MUSSBURGER'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: Mussburger still sits frozen in his chair. Outside the gr arched window Hudsucker rises, through the falling snow, his way back to the heavens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Ridin' six white horses, She'll  be ridin' six white horses She'll be  ridin' six white horses When she  comes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a great WRENCHING SOUND from the GEAR ROOM next d

dialogues.speaker: GEAR ROOM
dialogues.text: Moses pries the broom handle loose from the Great Gear. With a LOW MOAN the CLOCKWORKS start to shudder and turn

dialogues.speaker: SWEEP SECOND HAND
dialogues.text: Lurching forward --

dialogues.speaker: PERPETUAL MOTION BALL
dialogues.text: Swinging down --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Norville falls the last few feet and lands on his face with one last mighty BONG of the HUDSUCKER CLOCK.

dialogues.speaker: BOOM DOWN
dialogues.text: FROM a tavern sign that says ANN'S 440, DOWN TO the front door, which Norville is entering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting halfway down the bar is Amy, staring morosely int coffee cup. AT the CUT we are TRACKING BACK, PULLING AWAY FROM her. Norville enters, comes up next to her and makes the Go Ea sign, hooking his thumbs in front of his nose and spreadi his fingers. Two familiar voices narrate the scene, sounding a little  tipsy:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the heck's he doin', Benny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy looks at Norville, startled. After a moment she  reciprocates the sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the heck's she doin', Lou?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the heck they doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norville and Amy embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what they're doin' now,  Lou.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This I know, Benny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This you're familia' with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our PULL BACK ENDS LOOKING ACROSS an elbow of the bar, TO Norville and Amy, now in WIDE SHOT. Resting on the bar in the extreme f.g. are two champagne glasses, half-full of  fizzing champagne. Norville and Amy kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Geez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Geez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear LABORED, RASPY BREATHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Y'all right, Benny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a quavering voice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Yeah, I'm... It's just... It's  beautiful, Lou!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lou also is beginning to sound choked up:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is beautiful, Benny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost weeping as Norville and Amy continue their embrace

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...It's the most beautiful t'ing I  ever saw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the most beautiful t'ing I ever  saw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BARTENDER ENTERS to BLOCK our VIEW of Norville and Amy. He is youngish, with a beat goatee, wearing dungarees and sweatshirt with cut-off sleeves. He looks to either side Benny and Lou.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cats comin' from a party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cabbies' affair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hacks' New Year's gala.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crazy. Get you anything else? Sangria?  Carrot juice? Herbal tea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Benny and Lou are sitting side by side at the bar. Lou wears a fake whispy beard and white eyebrows and a lo flowing robe; he holds a fake scythe. On the bar next to sits a large hourglass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bromo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benny is wearing nothing but an oversized diaper, a baby  bonnett and a sash across his hairy chest and thick belly that says "1959." He chucks himself in the heart, cocks his head and sucks air, then blows it back out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Bromo.

dialogues.speaker: BLUE LETTER
dialogues.text: Lying on the boardroom table. As a hand enters to lay a  wristwatch on the table next to it, we hear the voice of  Moses, the old maintenance man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so began 1959. The new year...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hand reenters to lay down a wallet, and then to depos a burning cigar in an ashtray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And the start of a new business  cycle. When he learned that Norville  owned the comp'ny, ol' Sidney was  upset at first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We TILT UP to show that Mussburger is walking toward the  boardroom window. Board members silently remonstrate with him as he tries to wrench it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...It's a good thing Doc  Bromfenbrenner was there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Bromfenbrenner stands to one side watching, brow  furrowed, a pencil pressed to his lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...'cause he was able to keep Sidney  from harmin' his ol' self.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We...

dialogues.speaker: BARRED DOOR
dialogues.text: being slammed behind Sidney who, straight-jacketed, is pu on a cigar as he is led away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Now Norville, he went on an' ruled  with wisdom and compassion...

dialogues.speaker: BOARDROOM
dialogues.text: Again. Norville is eagerly pointing at a design he has up an easel: Under the heading BRAND NEW is a large circle. side view is a flat line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and started dreamin' up them  excitin' new ideas again. You know,  for kids!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The board members look at the design, puzzled. Norville takes a drop cloth off of a piece of plastic on pedestal. He has the board's complete attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...An' that's the story of how  Norville Barnes climbed away up to  the forty-fourth floor of the  Hudsucker Buildin'...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up the plastic disc and as he sails it we...

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: As it floats out the boardroom window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...an' then fell all the way down,  but didn't quite squish hisself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We BOOM UP, AWAY FROM the boardroom, to the great Hudsuck Clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Ya know, they say there was a man  who jumped from the fortyfifth  floor... but that's another story.  Heh-heh-heh! Ya-heh-heh-heh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We FADE OUT on the clock as Moses' LAUGHTER grows distant and END MUSIC SWELLS.
